questions.question: In Ontario, a driver will be given 7 demerit points if he/she is convicted of:
answers: A. Following too close
B. Failing to stop for a stopped school bus with its red alternating lights on
C. Failing to remain at the scene of an accident
D. Failing to obey the directions of a police officer

questions.question: In Ontario, a first conviction for drinking and driving can bring a minimum license suspension of:
answers: A. 6 months
B. 12 months
C. 24 months
D. 48 months

questions.question: In Ontario, it is legal to turn right on red:
answers: A. Only after the vehicle has come to a complete stop yielding right of way.
B. Only from a one-way street to another one-way street
C. Only from a two-way street to another two-way street
D. Only from a one-way street to a two-way street

questions.question: A streetcar is stopped to load and unload passengers. A driver of a motor vehicle is approaching this streetcar from the rear. The driver must stop:
answers: A. 2 meters from the rear-most door at which the passengers are getting on or off
B. 3 meters from the rear-most door at which the passengers are getting on or off
C. 6 meters from the rear-most door at which the passengers are getting on or off
D. 9 meters from the rear-most door at which the passengers are getting on or off

questions.question: When approaching a level railway crossing with the gates down, the driver of a motor vehicle must:
answers: A. Stop 1 meter from the gates
B. Stop 3 meters from the line
C. Stop 5 meters from the first rail
D. Stop 15 meters from the railroad crossing

questions.question: In what lane should you drive if you intend to make a right turn:
answers: A. Close to the left of the roadway.
B. Close to the right hand side of the roadway.
C. Close to the centerline of the roadway.
D. Does not matter.

questions.question: Under the Graduated Licensing System in Ontario, the supervising driver must not let their Blood Alcohol Concentration exceed:
When approaching an intersection controlled by stop signs, where there are no lines on the road and no sidewalks, the legal stop position is:
answers: A. Where you can see clearly
B. At the stop sign
C. Before the stop sign
D. At the edge of the travelled portion of the roadway

questions.question: Before leaving the car parked on a downgrade, you should:
answers: A. Leave your front wheels parallel to the curb.
B. Turn your front wheels to the left and set the parking brakes.
C. Set the parking brakes only.
D. Turn your front wheels to the right and set the parking brakes.

questions.question: In Ontario, a solid yellow line at the left of your lane means:
answers: A. It is illegal to pass
B. It is unsafe to pass
C. It is illegal to cross over
D. It is legal to pass

questions.question: When approaching a stopped school bus from the rear with its red alternating lights and stop arm out, all drivers must stop:
answers: A. 5 feet from the rear of the bus
B. 2 meters from the rear of the bus
C. 2 car lengths back from the rear of the bus
D. 20 meters or 65 feet back from the rear of the bus

questions.question: When travelling on a one-way street, you see and hear an ambulance with its siren on coming towards you from the rear; what does the law require you to do:
answers: A. Pull to the nearest curb and stop
B. Pull to the left only and stop
C. Pull to the right only and stop
D. Slow down and let the ambulance pass you on your right

questions.question: In Ontario, it is legal to turn left on a red light when turning:
answers: A. From a two-way street to a one-way street, after coming to a complete stop and yielding right of way to other cars in the intersection.
B. From a one-way street to a two-way street
C. From a two-way street to a two-way street
D. From a one-way street to a one-way street

questions.question: When parallel parking on an uphill on the street without a curb, all drivers should angle their front wheels:
answers: A. Towards the right
B. Towards the left
C. Do not need to angle wheels if you use the parking brake
D. Always turn them to the left regardless of the hill

questions.question: When approaching an intersection where the signal lights are not working, you should:
answers: A. Treat it as an all way stop sign intersection.
B. Stop and wait until the intersection is clear
C. Park the car and direct the traffic yourself
D. Slow down and proceed with caution

questions.question: Snow removal vehicles have flashing lights of the following color:
answers: A. Red
B. Yellow
C. Green
D. Blue

questions.question: A flashing amber (yellow) signal light at an intersection means:
answers: A. Come to full stop
B. Slow down and drive with increased caution
C. Danger dead end highway
D. Signal out of order

questions.question: Which of the following vehicles only may carry a red light visible from the front:
answers: A. Commercial motor vehicles
B. Bicycles
C. Pleasure type motor vehicle
D. Emergency vehicle responding to a call

questions.question: When are drivers are required to use low beam headlights:
answers: A. Upon the approach of another vehicle
B. Within 150m of the approach of another vehicle
C. Within 300m of the approach of another vehicle
D. This is a safety practice, not a law.

questions.question: Where a highway has divided into lanes for traffic, a driver should:
answers: A. Move from lane to lane with bursts of speed when passing
B. Never change lanes
C. Signal intention and move to other lanes only when it is safe to do so.
D. Straddle lanes and block following traffic

questions.question: You are driving up to an intersection where there is no signal light or police officer, a pedestrian is in the crosswalk on your side of the street. You should:
answers: A. Increase speed and take the right-of-way
B. Slow down and drive with increased caution
C. Sound horn to warn the pedestrian
D. Stop and yield right-of-way to the pedestrian

questions.question: Overdriving your headlights at night is dangerous because:
answers: A. You are driving too fast.
B. Your headlights are too bright.
C. You cannot stop the distance that you can see.
D. It is not good for your car battery.

questions.question: As a level G2 driver, your blood alcohol level must not be over:
What documents may a police officer require a motor vehicle driver to produce:
answers: A. Liability insurance card.
B. Motor vehicle ownership.
C. A valid driverâ€™s license.
D. All of the above.

questions.question: While travelling on a highway, the driver of a vehicle is not permitted to carry in a trailer:
answers: A. Firearms
B. Flammable material
C. People
D. Pets.

questions.question: When on streets designed for two-way traffic, you hear the siren of an emergency vehicle, what does the law require you to do:
answers: A. Speed up and get out of the way.
B. Signal the driver to pass.
C. Pull to the right as far as possible and stop.
D. Continue on the same speed.

questions.question: Which of the following has the right of way over all the others at an intersection when the signal light is green:
answers: A. Pedestrians crossing against the light.
B. Pedestrians crossing with the light.
C. Vehicles turning right
D. Vehicles turning left.

questions.question: If a traffic signal changes while the pedestrian is still in the street, which of the following has the right of way:
answers: A. Motorists making turns.
B. The pedestrian
C. Motorist coming from his right
D. Motorist coming from his left.

questions.question: As a level one G1 driver, you must be accompanied by a class G or higher licensed driver, who has more than the following driving experience:
answers: A. Three years
B. Four years
C. Eight years
D. Six years.

questions.question: Unless otherwise posted, the maximum speed limit in cities, towns, villages and built up area is:
answers: A. 50 km/hr
B. 40 km/hr
C. 30 km/hr
D. 60 km/hr

questions.question: Upon approaching a stop sign, a driver must:
answers: A. Slow down, sound horn and then proceed.
B. Slow down, and if the way is clear, proceed.
C. Stop, sound horn, then proceed.
D. Stop, and when it is safe to do so, proceed.

questions.question: You should under all conditions drive at a speed which will allow you to:
answers: A. Stop within 90 meters.
B. Stop within 60 meters.
C. Stop within a safe distance.
D. Stop within 150 meters.

questions.question: When may you lend your driverâ€™s license:
answers: A. Never.
B. To another person who is learning to drive.
C. For identification purposes only.
D. Only in emergency.

questions.question: Are drivers responsible for their passengers buckling up:
answers: A. Only if passengers are from five years of age to sixteen years.
B. Only if the passengers are over sixteen years of age.
C. Only if passengers are in the first seat.
D. Only if the passengers are over eighteen years of age.

questions.question: Demerit points accumulated will remain on your driverâ€™s record for a period of how many years from the date of offence:
answers: A. One year.
B. Three years.
C. Two years.
D. Five years.

questions.question: As a level one or level two driver, if you collect nine or more points during a two-year period, your license will be suspended for:
answers: A. 60 days.
B. 30 days.
C. 1 year.
D. 15 days.

questions.question: Never change lanes without:
answers: A. Signaling and decreasing speed.
B. Signaling, checking rear view mirrors and checking blind spots.
C. Blowing your horn and providing appropriate hand signals.
D. Checking rear view mirror.

questions.question: When a red signal light with a green arrow is shown at an intersection it means:
answers: A. Stop and wait for green signal before making turn in the direction of the arrow.
B. The green arrow is a signal for pedestrians only.
C. Stop and then proceed.
D. Proceed with caution in the direction of the arrow.

questions.question: When 15 or more demerit points have accumulated, the G driver's license is suspended:
answers: A. At the discretion of the Ministry.
B. Automatically, and for 30 days from receipt of license.
C. Automatically, and for 60 days from receipt of license.
D. For 3 months.

questions.question: When approaching an intersection and you notice the roadway beyond the intersection is blocked with traffic, you should:
answers: A. Proceed slowly into the intersection until the traffic ahead moves on.
B. Keep as close as possible to the car ahead.
C. Sound horn to warn cars ahead to move on.
D. Stop before entering the intersection and wait until traffic ahead moves on.
